meanings.definition: A sudden and forceful movement backwards.
meanings.sent1: The unexpected backrush knocked him off balance.
meanings.sent2: I felt a backrush as I stumbled and fell backward.
meanings.sent3: The backrush of the door closing made me jump.
meanings.sent4: The backrush of memories flooded my mind.
meanings.sent5: The backrush of wind nearly blew my hat off.

meanings.definition: To move or flow rapidly in a backward direction.
meanings.sent1: She had to backrush to avoid the oncoming car.
meanings.sent2: The water began to backrush as the dam opened.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally backrushed into the wall while trying to step back.
meanings.sent4: Emotions backrush when I think of that moment.
meanings.sent5: The crowd started to backrush towards the exit after the show ended.
